Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.players

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.players.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Target, java.io.Serializable
    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements Target, java.io.Serializable
    The class representing a player of the match. It offers all the method necessary to allow the player to do whats it should.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • findPowerUp

        public PowerUpCard findPowerUp​(java.lang.String name,
                               Color color)
                        throws CardNotFoundException
        Searches a power up based on its name and color.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the power up.
        color - The color o the power up.
        Returns:
        The PowerUpCard object.
        Throws:
        CardNotFoundException - If the searched power up is not present in player's hand.

        public void removePlayerFromBoard()

      • move

        public void move​(EffectArgument effectTarget,
                 EffectHandler effectHandler)
          throws PropertiesException,
                 EffectException,
                 IllegalActionException
        Performs the "move" action.
        Parameters:
        effectTarget - The target of the move effect, which is this player.
        effectHandler - The effectHandler of the match.
        Throws:
        PropertiesException - If there are some problems with the properties of the target during the execution of the effect.
        EffectException - If there are some problems with the execution of the effect.
        IllegalActionException - If the action can0t be performed right now.

      • collect

        public AmmoTile collect()
                 throws SquareException,
                        EmptySquareException,
                        IllegalActionException
        Performs the "collect" action when the player is in a square that is not a spawn square.
        Returns:
        The ammo tile collected.
        Throws:
        SquareException - If the player is in a spawn square.
        EmptySquareException - If the square is empty.
        IllegalActionException - If the action cannot be performed at the moment.

      • collect

        public void collect​(int cardId,
                    java.util.List<PowerUpCard> powerUpCards)
             throws CardException,
                    IllegalActionException
        Performs the "collect" action when the player is in a spawn square and doesn't need to discard a card.
        Parameters:
        cardId - The id of the card to collect.
        powerUpCards - The power ups with which the user may want to pay the cost of the card.
        Throws:
        CardException - If the card can't be found in the square.
        IllegalActionException - If the action cannot be performed at th moment.

      • collect

        public void collect​(int squareCardId,
                    int playerCardId,
                    java.util.List<PowerUpCard> powerUpCards)
             throws CardException,
                    IllegalActionException
        Performs the "collect" action when the player is in a spawn square and needs to discard a card.
        Parameters:
        squareCardId - The id of the card to collect.
        playerCardId - The id of the card to discard.
        powerUpCards - The power ups with which the user may want to pay the cost of the card.
        Throws:
        CardException - If the card can't be found in the square.
        IllegalActionException - If the action cannot be performed at th moment.

      • reload

        public void reload​(int cardId,
                   java.util.List<PowerUpCard> powerUpCardList)
            throws IllegalActionException,
                   CardException
        Performs the "reload" action. Reloads the weapon given as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        cardId - The id of the card to discard.
        powerUpCardList - The power ups with which the user may want to pay the cost of the card.
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - If the action cannot be performed at th moment.
        CardException - If the card can't be found in player's hand.

      • activateCard

        public void activateCard​(int cardId)
                  throws CardException,
                         IllegalActionException
        Activates the card chosen by the user.
        Parameters:
        cardId - The id of the card to activate.
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - If the action cannot be performed at th moment.
        CardException - If the card can't be found in player's hand.

      • useCard

        public void useCard​(EffectType effectType,
                    EffectArgument effectTarget,
                    java.util.List<PowerUpCard> powerUpCardList)
             throws PropertiesException,
                    EffectException,
                    CardException,
                    IllegalActionException
        Performs the "useCard" action.
        Parameters:
        effectType - The type of the effect that the user wants to be executed (primary/alternative/optionali1/optional2).
        effectTarget - The targets of the effect.
        powerUpCardList - The power ups with which the user may want to pay the cost of the effect.
        Throws:
        PropertiesException - if there are some problems with the effect and target properties.
        EffectException - If there are some problems during the execution of the effect (or it can't be used at the moment).
        IllegalActionException - If the action cannot be performed at th moment.
        CardException - If the card can't be found in player's hand.

      • spawn

        public PowerUpCard spawn​(java.lang.String name,
                         Color color)
                  throws IllegalActionException,
                         CardNotFoundException
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException
        CardNotFoundException

      • toJsonObject

        public javax.json.JsonObject toJsonObject()
        This method creates a JsonObjectBuilder containing all the information needed in the View. To the said JsonObjectBuilder will be added some JsonValues in the GameHandler.toJsonObject() method, and that will be sent to the view when needed.
        Returns:
        The JsonObect containig all the information of this card.
